SEARCH
Package pl.so5dz.aprs4j

Class Callsign

java.lang.Object
pl.so5dz.aprs4j.Callsign
public class Callsign extends Object
Represents an APRS callsign as found in a TNC2-formatted packet.
Constructor is package-private, use of(String) to create a new instance.

Callsigns are composed of a base, an optional SSID and an optional repeated marker.
Details of each part can be found in the documentation of it's dedicated setter.
(see setBase(String), setSSID(Integer), setRepeated(boolean))

Example callsigns:

  • AB1CDE (main station callsign, non-repeated)
  • AB1CDE-1* (substation 1, repeated)
  • WIDE2-2 (special: digipeating instruction)
  • qAR (special: APRS-IS q-construct)

  • Method Details

    • of

      public static Callsign of(String str)
      Creates a new Callsign from a string in TNC2 format.
      Parameters:
      str - the string to parse
      Returns:
      the new Callsign
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the string is not a valid TNC2 callsign

    • getBase

      public String getBase()
      Returns the callsign base (legal callsign).
      Returns:
      the callsign base of this callsign object

    • setBase

      public void setBase(String base)
      Sets the callsign base.

      The base is the main part of the callsign, and may be a legal callsign, a q-construct or a digipeating instruction.
      It is always required, and must be between 3 and 9 characters long.

      Legal callsigns and digipeating instructions are composed of uppercase letters and digits.
      The first character must be a letter.

      q-constructs are composed of a lowercase 'q' followed by exactly 2 uppercase letters.

      Parameters:
      base - the new callsign base
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the base is null, too short, too long or otherwise not valid

    • getSSID

      public Integer getSSID()
      Returns the SSID specified in the callsign.
      Returns:
      the SSID specified in the callsign, or null if the callsign has no SSID

    • setSSID

      public void setSSID(Integer ssid)
      Sets the SSID in the callsign.

      The SSID is an optional part of the callsign, separated from the base by a hyphen.
      It is a number between 1 and 15 (inclusive). 0 is accepted, but considered an "absent" value equivalent to null.

      Parameters:
      ssid - the new SSID or 0/null if the callsign should have no SSID
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the SSID is not a number or is out of the valid range

    • isRepeated

      public boolean isRepeated()
      Returns whether the callsign is marked as repeated.
      Returns:
      true if the callsign is repeated, false otherwise

    • setRepeated

      public void setRepeated(boolean repeated)
      Sets a flag indicating the callsign has acted as a repeater.
      Parameters:
      repeated - true if the callsign is repeated, false otherwise
